dt: {bc}to command solemnly under or as if under oath or penalty of a curse

pt: {sc}beg{/sc} {sc}entreat{/sc} {sc}beseech{/sc} {sc}implore{/sc} {sc}supplicate{/sc} {sc}adjure{/sc} {sc}importune{/sc} mean to ask urgently. {sc}beg{/sc} suggests earnestness or insistence in the asking.
{sc}entreat{/sc} implies an effort to persuade or to overcome resistance.
{sc}beseech{/sc} and {sc}implore{/sc} imply a deeply felt anxiety.

pt.t: with bowed heads they {it}supplicated{/it} their Lord

pt: {sc}adjure{/sc} implies advising as well as pleading.

pt.t: we were {it}adjured{/it} to tell the truth

pt: {sc}importune{/sc} suggests an annoying persistence in trying to break down resistance to a request.

et: Middle English {it}adjuren,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}ajurer,{/it} borrowed from Latin {it}adjūrāre{/it} "to affirm with an oath, swear," from {it}ad-{/it} {et_link|ad-|ad-} + {it}jūrāre{/it} "to swear" {ma}{mat|jury:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to command solemnly under or as if under oath or penalty of a curse
